an1.575-615:4.1: “Mendicants, anyone who brings into their mind the great ocean includes all of the streams that run down into it.
an1.575-615:4.2: So too, anyone who has developed and cultivated mindfulness of the body includes all of the wholesome qualities that play a part in realization.”
an1.575-615:6.1: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to great inspiration… great benefit … great sanctuary … mindfulness and awareness … gaining knowledge and vision … blissful meditation in the present life … the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.
an1.575-615:6.4: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads to great inspiration… great benefit … great sanctuary … mindfulness and awareness … gaining knowledge and vision … a happy abiding in the present life … the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.”
an1.575-615:8.1: “When one thing, mendicants, is developed and cultivated the body and mind become tranquil, thinking and considering settle down, and all of the qualities that play a part in realization are developed to perfection.
an1.575-615:8.4: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, the body and mind become tranquil, thinking and considering settle down, and all of the qualities that play a part in realization are developed to perfection.”
an1.575-615:10.1: “When one thing, mendicants, is developed and cultivated, unwholesome qualities do not arise, and, if they’ve already arisen, they are given up.
an1.575-615:10.4: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, unwholesome qualities do not arise, and, if they’ve already arisen, they are given up.”
an1.575-615:12.1: “When one thing, mendicants, is developed and cultivated, wholesome qualities arise, and, once they’ve arisen, they increase and grow.
an1.575-615:12.4: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, wholesome qualities arise, and, once they’ve arisen, they increase and grow.”
an1.575-615:14.1: “When one thing, mendicants, is developed and cultivated, ignorance is given up, knowledge arises, the conceit ‘I am’ is given up, the tendencies are uprooted, and the fetters are given up.
an1.575-615:14.4: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, ignorance is given up, knowledge arises, the conceit ‘I am’ is given up, the tendencies are uprooted, and the fetters are given up.”
an1.575-615:16.1: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to demolition by wisdom … to extinguishment without grasping.
an1.575-615:16.4: This one thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to demolition by wisdom … to extinguishment without grasping.”
an1.575-615:18.1: “When one thing is developed and cultivated there is the penetration of the many and diverse elements, the analysis of many elements.
an1.575-615:18.4: When this one thing is developed and cultivated there is the penetration of the many and diverse elements, the analysis of many elements.”
an1.575-615:20.1: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to the realization of the fruit of stream-entry … once-return … non-return … perfection.
an1.575-615:20.4: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads to the realization of the fruit of stream-entry … once-return … non-return … perfection.”
an1.575-615:22.1: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated, leads to the getting of wisdom … the growth of wisdom … the increase of wisdom … to great wisdom … to widespread wisdom … to abundant wisdom … to deep wisdom … to extraordinary wisdom … to vast wisdom … to much wisdom … to fast wisdom … to light wisdom … to laughing wisdom … to swift wisdom … to sharp wisdom … to penetrating wisdom.
an1.575-615:22.4: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads to the getting of wisdom … the growth of wisdom … the increase of wisdom … to great wisdom … to widespread wisdom … to abundant wisdom … to deep wisdom … to extraordinary wisdom … to vast wisdom … to much wisdom … to fast wisdom … to light wisdom … to laughing wisdom … to swift wisdom … to sharp wisdom … to penetrating wisdom.”
